title: Energy change for given mass of K

content.question: Which of the following is true when the <math alttext="3.9 grams" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.9</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math alttext="K, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> has completely reacted?

choices.label: <math alttext="10, decimal point, kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is absorbed by the reaction.
<math alttext="20, decimal point, kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is absorbed by the reaction.
<math alttext="10, decimal point, kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is released by the reaction.
<math alttext="20, decimal point, kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is released by the reaction.

content.answer: <math alttext="20, decimal point, kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is released by the reaction.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
